topic.title: Creating a new moderated directory.
topic.body:
Creating a new directory to try and sort the crap from working sites. i love this decentralized concept but it open the doors for sooo much shit posting. if anyone out there has legit good zites they know of please submit them to me here. 

 ZeroNet Moderated Directory
http://127.0.0.1:43110/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/Submit.html

there isn't much there now but i am building on it as often as i can, would really like to see this P2P internet idea expand, and part of that is making good and functional sites.

topic.title: Zeronet moderated directory - Add your site/s
topic.body:
Check out the directory here, 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/index.html

We are adding more sites each week to try create a reliable and up to date directory for zeronet sites. If you have one or know of some you can submit them here. (no CP or Extreme violence)

http://127.0.0.1:43110/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/submitsite.html

Together we can help expand the network and make it usable for everyone.

Thank you.

Revolution Pirate Radio **Help Request**
topic.body:
Hi everyone, I am trying to bring the video section up however, I keep getting a content to large message when i try to sign and publish i even raised the site storage higher than the file sizes and nothing. i edited the content.json file to include it in the optional section of the file but it wont take it. any ideas? Thank you.

example:
"optional": "Shows/.*",
 "optional": "Video/.*",

topic.title: removing files, keep comming back.
topic.body:
hello all, having an issue when trying to remove files. 
i am trying to remove some content from a website here but the same content keeps coming back, i am guessing from seeders, how do i delete content and have it propagate the seeds without it re-downloading in my site directory??? Thanks in advance

topic.title: Revolution Pirate Radio - Published to new address
topic.body:
Hello everyone,
I have decided to delete the current site as i have been having nothing but problems publishing  & Synchronizing content, not sure what went wrong but never the less we are starting over, I have moved the site to a new address and will be limiting content to keep the size of the site kind of reasonable. I will try to compress video content as small as i can get it without major degradation of quality. I will eventually add an archive site for those that want to check out past content but its not a priority right now. News site address is 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EDk3RoAaFBMEsu4jGuDnpRiKiMMLTUKNd/index.html

 The site size is set to 1GB and i will do my best to keep the main site within that limit. Please update your bookmarks or favourites, hopefully this move will fix some issues with synchronization for seeders.

Thank You for your interest..
Nighthawk..

topic.title: Revolution Pirate Radio - Update
topic.body:
I think i have isolated the issues with site size and downloads,  (Thank you, styromaniac, musicz4, smashbuckler, zeroseed2 and mg0 for all your ideas and input.) The site should now only require a 10MB download to get the basic files to run the site, Actual content however should start downloading as requested.

To avoid delays every time you request something you can seed the site by toggling " Help distribute added optional files" to ON. 

Please let me know of any other issues, I am still trying to figure out the "TOR ERROR" i get . not good with tor so im not sure how that affects the site. Thank you.

topic.title: Revolution pirate radio - File size issue help
topic.body: ok so i have noticed that all my optional files start to download on my seeding machine and then max out at 5.2 mb,  all files stop at exactly that size.does anyone know why this happens? is it a setting i need to change in the content.json file?? Thank you...

1569594101_14A3LXiT8D3gtRGJSMG3eMbKDtRPd.body:
part of it is all the crap on the network, test pages and ppl being generally stupid. not a good first impression for the average new user. i have started a new directory to try and filter out some of that stuff. you can submit sites for review here http://127.0.0.1:43110/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/Submit.html

together we "could turn this into something worthwhile.

> [reichardnixon](#comment_40_16NfWw2hgzGaVcQs35UJySKMf4YP9kZFbr): your site has zero seeds?

ya right now its not known, its literally a few days old, im sure over time it will gain a little momentum. plus i cant control the seeding practices of others. some will seed it some wont. that's just the nature of P2P. hopwfully over time users will find value in seeding it.

> [reichardnixon](#comment_41_16NfWw2hgzGaVcQs35UJySKMf4YP9kZFbr): but it should have at least you seeding right? I like your idea so I was going to help but it just errors out.

really thats odd,  i am seeding it myself too, and i can see it on my phone and laptop so at min there should be 3 seeds. what kind of errors if you dont mind me asking??

> [reichardnixon](#comment_42_16NfWw2hgzGaVcQs35UJySKMf4YP9kZFbr): No Peers FoundCONTENT.JSON DOWNLOAD FAILEDCONTENT.JSON DOWNLOAD FAILED

hmmmm thats interesting. i will look into it, i have seen that happen on alot of sites i have tried to see as well. if anyone reading this thread has any suggestions im all eyes :)

ok great i did fiddle with the port settings on my router maybe that had an effect. hope you find it useful. any sugestions are welcome from everyone

1571495142_1AgZWGTVyEyp3FYduWpZ5dhB5GhXw.body:
I think it is a great concept and also great practice in development. problem is there is alot of shit on here and dead links as ppl post crap and then forget about it. lazy and inconsiderate, even some of the search engines here point to a ton of dead links. i am building a new directory where i verify every site to see that its working and hosts some content. as well as filtering out (to the best of my ability anyway) undesirable links to content. you can list your sites there if you like just submit them to me and ill check them out.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/

> [esoter101](#comment_2_1AgZWGTVyEyp3FYduWpZ5dhB5GhXw9FUaP): Thanks for the insight. Just want to clarify, I don't mean 'real content development' in terms of what people may or may not like. I am referring more to the time investment of developing a quality website.

well the way i see it if nothing else its a good free place to test and develop a site, i have several on here now that i work on, some I make to try and help others gain some value out of the zeronet concept, others are personal hobbies and testing. so putting the time in to a quality site will help move it forward, as you can see just by browsing even for a short time a lot of site are very low end, now thats likely caused by the P2P nature of zeronet, ppl get concerned about storing content on their computers. that being said i develop sites as if they would be hosted in a conventional ways, size is what it is, you will have some ppl that simply wont seed and thats fine, some will and some like myself seed several sites on a separate server because i like the project as a whole and want to see it succeed.  plus editing on multiple computers is sooo simple, again no logins, just use your private keys and you can update sites from anywhere.  

i think if some nicely made and useful content showed up on here it would help push it forward. we need some legitimate and maintained sites on here rather than all the typical stupidity that always manifests itself in un moderated communities. think 90s internet, thats where zeronet is now. but with a little effort from developers we can turn it around.

1571981535_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: the short answer is yes, by law you would be held criminally responsible for possession and distribution of it if its found on you computer. doesn't matter how it got there.

Personally i wont seed any sites that post it. and i wont knowingly list them either, that kind of content does not deserve to be protected by personal freedom of speech or expression. I don't care what the argument is. If your storing it regardless of how or why and your caught, you pay the price for it. Everyone knows the legalities of it. ignorance is no excuse.

1570906788_1ErPX9yuZjokdcxUGavdRYRhwynA4.body: i had put up a video in the home page, thinking it might be helpful for new users i have since removed it.

> [xcape2net](#comment_481_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I always prefer speed, ease of use, and low system requirements to glitzy gimmicks.  The glitzy gimmicks are what I think is wrong with the clearnet.

I agree and i am trying to strike a balance, keep it small and simple while making it look appealing, any expansions going forward will be embedded links to a separate site so only ppl interested in larger content will need to download it. that keeps the base site small while still facilitating the option of more multi media style content.

1572513197_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
> [pineapples](#comment_92_19XCfah7iuo9zYqk7GoTDXVNp4p5BpEH1T): i agree that is a good point.  consent is important and the idea that you must be of a certain age to give consent is also important.  i am glad that you pointed that out because i overlooked it.  with that framework, paedophilia will always be illegal i hope.  i think that the best approach to solving paedophilia is kinda along the lines of what nekoili was saying about how we handle it as a mental illness.  currently if you walked into a therapist's office and disclosed your paedophilic tendencies they would likely refuse treatment and call the cops immediately.  We need to treat it more like we treat people who go to rehab for drug use.  no one raids a drug user's house or refuses them treatment because they use drugs.  i think the reason there is such a difference between how we treat drug use and paedophilia is most people cannot understand peadophilia while most people can understand and have probably participated in the use of drugs.  I am not sure how to understand peadophilia however we can treat it like other mental illnesses that the average person doesn't understand such as schizophrenia.  We need to help those that seek help and those that need help but might not seek help.

Weather its a mental illness or not it cant be treated the same way your example states, though it may be similar in to textbooks interpretation of addiction. A drug user depends on a chemical reaction with the brain to get their fix, pedos require a physical connection to children for theirs. so naturally one would have to contact  law enforcement if it is discovered. You can turn a blind eye to drugs as it really only affects the user themselves,  paedophilia affect children directly. even if if someone dosent interact with children directly and just collects pornographic imagery. it still feeds an underground industry that exploits kids.

1573172203_17LTVhar6FUm7BRaj8FFcoVDVkTr1.body: zeronet will never be like the surface web, there is no money to be made here.

1573243995_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6.body: All i have to say is that the left have literally lost their minds. God help America and the world is the current radical democratic party gains power again.  don't forget silicon valley is predominantly blue so the fact that the linux foundation did this is not surprising at all. its stupid but not surprising.

1579445364_17KQehVm2u5r4GAjqkC3jRcxepzK6.body:
You bring up a great point, the way i see it seeding is a huge issue and for good reason. Reliability and Speed being hugely affected.

A  lot of people do not understand the importance of seeding on these types of networks. Add to that some contents questionable nature and you cant really blame them. Its unfortunate but networks like this are rampant with dead links and illegal content both of witch severely prohibit any main stream adoption.

I mean with government and law enforcement's active surveillance on these networks constantly most people wont seed sites to their computer for fear of being in possession of illegal content and having their equipment seized. i mean with laws constantly changing one could be charged and prosecuted for dam near anything these days, from hate speech to copyrighted or illegal content. That's one reason i have created the Zeronet Moderated Directory, To try and compile a working directory of sites on here and to filter out real harsh content. However its a tricky process to balance freedom of speech or expression against what governments and law enforcement consider appropriate.
I do try to filter out real bad stuff to the best of my ability but as with anything on a network like this, you just never know whats down the road..

I have no love for government overreach by any stretch and for a network like this to be successful people need to take risks and seed the sites they like, otherwise its a waste of time...

1580335642_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
i agree, there is nothing wrong with zeronet, it works and it works well for what it is, sure it could be better but that's the way it is with all newer ideas and tech, we need more seeders for zites and ppl need to stop being scared to seed stuff. use common sense and stay away from illegal content and focus on adding/ promoting useful zites. gotta take the good with the bad, especially with a decentralized network like this. yes you will run into a lot of crap, but there are useful and informative zites as well. 

if you know of any you can add them here and help create a updated and filtered directory of content.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/18QPAtqyoxriNcNAi4mkCHyoLENwTEbFyw/index.html

1587248692_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: i use https://mewe.com/ on the surface net.

Well i guess it depends on what you want, ya mewe has some content restrictions and policies as it is a more mainstream social network that is competing directly with facebook, but the learning curve is relatively simple and its easy to use and appealing to the eye, if all you want to do is have a closed family community to chat with its great, NO ads and you can restrict who sees you and your posts, there are also lots of groups you can join covering endless topics of discussion, and its as friendly as you care to make it. Sure there are places like zeronet, freenet, tor and mastodon as examples where you can basically say and post whatever you want but you deal with alot of bullshit trolls and twisted ppl and it can be offensive and confusing for new people. not knocking the networks as they have their place, but the closest thing to an actual Facebook replacement that i know of is MEWE. and their censorship policies are nowhere near the level of Facebook. also worth noting, they don't collect your data. (So they say anyway).. cant hurt to investigate it.

> [robione](#comment_518_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): https://signal.org

signal is a great facebook messenger replacement...

(The Process). Their greed for power and perhaps their underestimation of the intelligence of the Trump administration and the American people has come back to haunt them as  they have blatantly broke constitutional boundaries. Why do you think the left and their media counterparts are fighting back soo hard if there was no fuckery.  Trump is brilliant for tying it up in the courts, because the constitutional time restraints are on his side. full hand recounts are legal and take time, states must certify votes by a certain time, if they cant the state is null and neither candidate are awarded the electoral votes, that could bring the counts down below 270, if that happens the decision is then handed off to the House of Representatives. that would basically ensure trump stays as republicans vastly out number democrats in the House of Representatives. 1606080511_134skDNbvpgm7WpAjiJzbc6dQEfBa.body:
Go back to your centralized, protected and politically correct world if you don't like it here.  Most of us are quite aware that governments monitor shit on all the underground networks, and we know some of the trash that shows up on networks like this (its sad but its part of the game in an uncensored decentralized network), you don't have to visit sites like that or preach to us about it. Most of us come here for an unbiased freedom to speak and get shit off our chest because we know that the main stream sites shadow-ban, censor and inhibit free speech and while governments may monitor stuff here, they cant ban it out right or shut it down , there is no central authority or cooperate board that can ban us just because the powers that be disagree. 

I do however agree with you on the illegal content issues though. that certainly doesn't help the advancement of platforms like this at all. BUT  that's the beauty and the curse of these networks. everyone has a voice, good or evil.
